result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan Taylor Hall

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jordan Taylor Hall appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas M Weege appeared by video for Jordan Taylor Hall.  Student Intern Kylan Reilly under the supervision of Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jordan Taylor Hall appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court for Jordan Taylor Hall.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court reinstated signature bond.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 9-27-2022.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until 9-30-2022 at 08:30 am for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 40.  Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.

Defendant Jordan Taylor Hall not in court.  Attorney Nicholas M Weege appeared by video for Jordan Taylor Hall.  Prosecuting Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing; a bench warrant was previously imposed, but stayed. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered the stay lifted on the bench warrant, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Jordan Taylor Hall appeared by video but did not stay connected. Attorney Nicholas M Weege appeared by video for Jordan Taylor Hall.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant did not stay logged on via Zoom and did not reconnect. Court orders Bench Warrant issued but stayed. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jordan Taylor Hall in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/17/2022@2:30p
